label: 摺り染
本: Exhibition of Shōsō-in Treasures , The 55th  . Nara National Museum . 2003
説明文: A method of dyeing patterns by stamping or printing. Stamped patterns are made by carving the motif in relief on a woodblock, painting it with dye or ink, and pressing it to the cloth to transfer the color. Printed patterns are made by applying color through the openwork design of a stencil.
